attributes.comment:
The waiting time for an adoption from most international countries (e.g. China) has
lengthened considerably over the past decade. It is not uncommon for wait times
to reach or exceed 24 months before our adoption is complete. This timeframe
forces many adoptive parents to reapply for the I-600A twice, and now in some
cases three times. This represents a significant and unnecessary financial
hardship for many potential adoptive families (including ours). International
adoption is an extremely expensive and time consuming process. The potential
for increased the fees for waiting families represents an additional undue hardship
with no clear definition as to how the increase would help decrease the cost or
time to adopt a waiting child.

We would respectfully ask that any bill passed exclude or waive any fee increases
applicable to adoption related activities (both international and domestic).

Thank you for your thoughtful consideration.

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by James Henderson
